introduction.title: Romain Weigel
introduction.content: Constantly seeking knowledge, I quickly adapt and am always eager to learn. My name is Romain Weigel, and I am a third-year computer science student in Annecy. I am diligent in my personal work and highly committed to my personal development. I am looking for a position in software, video game, or mobile programming due to my interest in these fields.

projects.title: Projects
projects.content: Here is a list of my projects.

project1.title: Lunar Storms
project1.description: My game created in Unreal Engine 5 using Blueprints is still in beta and will improve over time. Created exclusively by Romain Weigel, this game offers a multiplayer survival experience on an island where players face enemies and various events. To overcome these challenges, we have powers to help us survive and work as a team. The game was published on itch.io.

project2.title: Follow Weight
project2.description: An internship project of a mobile application developed in Flutter with a database hosted on OVH. This app, developed during my 2-month second-year computer science internship with an entrepreneur, aims to help users understand and address personal and complex weight loss issues. At the end of my internship, the app reached a maturity level sufficient to be presented to a company, which took over the project in partnership with the entrepreneur, hence it was not published.

project3.title: FifApi
project3.description: An API created for a group project at the end of my second year in my B.Tech. I managed the entire API design with a colleague, including a website built with it. The API was published and managed via GitHub and Azure. Everything was built from scratch using a code-first approach.

project4.title: YouToo
project4.description: This Android Studio app created in Kotlin allows users who want to achieve their fitness goals to do so autonomously. Developed during my first year in computer science (2022/2023) as a personal project, it provides custom workout sessions that adapt to the user's progress and individual needs. However, this app is no longer available on the stores due to lack of time to address privacy policy and terms of use issues.

project5.title: My AI Work
project5.description: We study AI at our school, and I have created a full structure around everything we have learned and what we will present in our project for the first semester of the third year in computer science. It was slightly revised by one of my professors.

project6.title: AI for Predicting Room Temperature
project6.description: This is a dataset project to test AI once in Python and a better version in C#. It predicts the temperature of multiple rooms over several days. Currently, the data is entirely randomly generated by one of the Python programs, but it works well with real data as long as all data points are present.

project7.title: Monster Hunter Mobile App
project7.description: This personal project was designed specifically for myself, as I am passionate about the Monster Hunter universe. I wanted to create a real mobile app, especially since none exist on the Play Store. This app, developed in Flutter on Visual Studio Code, is simple and aims to assist me daily in researching and learning about this game.

project8.title: API for Overwatch
project8.description: This personal project was created for two reasons. The first was to develop an API to help me with my second-year computer science exams. The second was to gather additional information on video game characters I enjoy.

contact.title: Contact Me
contact.availability: I am available: Monday - Friday, 6 PM to 9 PM
